patents.title: CONTEXTUAL USE AND EXPIRATION OF DIGITAL CONTENT
patents.description: Technologies related to contextual use and expiration of digital content are generally described. In some examples, a receiving device may connect with a sponsoring device having the digital content. A relationship property defines a relationship context between the receiving device and the sponsoring device. The receiving device may receive the digital content from the sponsoring device and use the digital content so long as allowed, as determined with reference to the relationship property.

experience.description_html:
Working in Growth & GTM Team at Crossbeam

Crossbeam is the first and largest Ecosystem-Led Growth platform, used by over 30,000 companies to attract, convert, and grow customer relationships using their partner ecosystems.

Mission:
Maximized the impact of product and new features by turning complex technical and qualitative info into clear messaging for users and internal teams.

Collaborated with the Marketing team to plan and executed external communication campaigns across multiple channels to drive both product adoption and user acquisition.

Implemented strategies to increase active users on the platform by utilizing in-app messaging, targeted email campaigns, and interactive product tours.

Created clear, engaging content to inform external users about product updates, including feature announcements, how-to guides, and demo videos to boost awareness and usage.

Provided internal teams, including sales and customer success, with updated product decks, demos, and sales enablement tools to effectively communicate product value and close deals.

recommendations: Chelsey Davis “I had the pleasure of working with Poojitha during her internship at Crossbeam, and I can confidently say she has been an incredible asset to our team. Starting her internship on the very first day of the Reveal and Crossbeam merger—a time of significant change and adjustment—Poojitha took it all in stride with a positive attitude and unwavering enthusiasm. One of Poojitha’s standout qualities is her ability to quickly learn new tools and processes. She doesn’t just familiarize herself with them; she dives deep to understand how to make a meaningful impact. Whether it’s jumping in to help on any project or bringing thoughtful, creative ideas to the table, Poojitha consistently goes above and beyond expectations. She’s unafraid to share her perspective, which has been invaluable in shaping our work. A few of her notable contributions include building out an onboarding flow for our Crossbeam for Sales product—a crucial project for our overall customer experience. Prior to her work, customers were left to navigate the product on their own. Thanks to Poojitha, we now have a structured, user-friendly onboarding flow that sets customers up for success. She also made significant strides in creating sales collateral, including sales overview decks for Crossbeam, Crossbeam for Sales, and Crossbeam Copilot. Her efforts extended to creating product demo tours for our website, showcasing our platform’s capabilities, and assisting with emails, in-app communications, and other marketing materials. Poojitha’s ability to adapt, her creativity, and her willingness to roll up her sleeves and tackle any challenge have made her an integral part of our team. I’m confident she will excel in whatever she pursues next, and I wholeheartedly recommend her for any opportunity that comes her way. She’s an absolute star, and I can’t wait to see all that she achieves in the future!”

Adèle Quéméner “I had the pleasure of working with Poojitha at Crossbeam, and she impressed me with how quickly she learned about Crossbeam’s product and processes. She created great content to promote Crossbeam to the right users. Poojitha is very autonomous, proactive and always has a very positive mindset. Working with her is a great experience!”

detailed_profile.name: Richard Newman CA, CFA, MBA
detailed_profile.position: Impact Investing | Sustainable Finance | Natural Climate Solutions
detailed_profile.about: Sustainable Finance Investment professional with more than 13 years' experience in the financial industry ranging from direct investing, corporate finance, and advisory. Most recently, his focus has been on providing strategic and technical advice on impact investing and blended finance within food, land and water systems in developing & emerging economies. Richard is registered as a chartered financial analyst (CFA) and as a chartered accountant (CA). He holds an MBA from the University of St. Gallen, Switzerland as well as a bachelor’s degree and an Honours degree in finance from the University of Stellenbosch, South Africa.

positions.title: Corporate Finance Manager
positions.description_html:
• Managed key investment banking and strategy projects with fees of up to €1M per mandate; emphasis on large cross-border transactions and strategic initiatives executed with cross-functional (Consulting, Risk, Tax, Audit) and international teams from 8 countries.
• Led several project teams on various Strategy and M&A (Sell- and Buy-side), Restructuring, and Infrastructure mandates with combined revenues of >30% of annual budget;
• Mentored team of 7 and facilitated their professional development, leading to 1 two-level and 6 one-level promotions;
• Endorsed for superior leadership, analytical and client-facing skills; promoted to manager in less than 4 years from start of career, ahead of 7 years average promotion cycle.

EXAMPLE PROJECTS

1. Advised Slovenian Ministry of Infrastructure on largest infrastructure project (+€1.2B):
• Analyzed project’s feasibility and compiled 400 page investment documentation together with 4 foreign offices, 2 other service lines and 2 external technical advisors (see LINK);
• Built complex financial and cost benefit (scenario) models;
• Defined organizational and legal structure with multiple stakeholders;
• Coordinated €400M debt raising process and managed investor relations;
• Presented results to European Investment Bank and Government of Slovenia, resulting in project execution.

2. Redefined new business and corporate strategy for a leading hospitality group in Adriatics, developed long-term shareholder exit plan under different scenarios and led an international debt raising process required as part of the new strategy.

3. Advised a leading Slovenian publishing house on its comprehensive restructuring effort, including analysis of current state, definition of strategic, operational and financial iniciatives, and development of long-term financial plan.

detailed_profile.name: Matteo Menegola
detailed_profile.position: Senior analyst working in Aviation industry
detailed_profile.about: Dependable, committed and strongly customer oriented professional with a pragmatic approach. During my 5 years experience at Leonardo Helicopters on Material Quality Control area I had the chance to deal with Customers and Suppliers Quality structures at all levels, from technicians to Quality / Maintenance managers, interacting proficiently. After a few months I quickly became the preferred point of contact among customers and within Leonardo Helicopter Customer Support and Services for all troubleshooting regarding quality and supply chain issues. Sound understanding of Aviation Legislation Part 21 / Part 145 / Part M. Eager to find a dynamic job to enhance and develop my skills in a multicultural environment. Deep knowledge in processes continuous improvement, customer services, logistics, support engineering , total quality management and lean approaches.

recommendations: Ron Frieman “Pierre is the consummate business partner and collaborates well with the executive team to develop and implement the strategic plan of the Company. He is well spoken and produces timely reporting which not only keys on areas for improvement but also notes action items to be considered for remediation. In Pierre’s last role, he was tasked and successfully built from scratch a strong and talented financial team. He has a strong work ethic and can always be relied on to accept multiple challenges at the same time and co-ordinates the individual work streams with his team to get the work done. Pierre is a charismatic people person and people throughout the organization look to him for leadership and guidance. I highly recommend Pierre for a Chief Financial Officer position and have confidence that he will certainly add tremendous value wherever his future takes him. ”

Edwin Castrillo “Working with Pierre for over a year was a pleasure. He provided the time and insight needed to make the work successful. He challenged the team in order to obtain the best from each participant. The project staff respected him and his willingness to get into the details and help direct decisions, often providing insights to the various constraints of the options under consideration. I found him to be extremely knowledgeable in all Finance process and a quick learner about the technology tools and their application to the problem. projects.title: Master's degree thesis: Study of a water heat exchanger for power electronics obtained by additive technology
projects.description: Study of a water heat-exchanger for power electronics components that is obtained byadditive production in aluminium alloy.In order to evaluate a possible and efficient production solution, both in functional andeconomic terms, two samples of the same component were compared: the first is obtainedby the traditional production solution for milling and braze-welding, with a second obtainedby additive production in aluminium alloy.This approach is chosen for the greater production flexibility of additive technology.In the end, a possible water heat-exchanger concept for e-power automotive sector invertermodules is proposed, to show other additive manufacturing processes possibilities.

projects.title: Bachelor's degree thesis: Axial steam turbine’s rotor blade of first stage approximated sizing
projects.description: Costructive axial steam turbine’s rotor blade of first stage approximated sizing for shippropulsion, whence initial data plant, the approximated profile’s extracted. The forces areextracted to which the blade is subjected and after a costructive study, the stresses arechecked, both on attack’s basic that on the blade. Finally, the best material is chosen for thecostruction.

detailed_profile.name: Ralph El-Nachef
detailed_profile.position: MBA (IE) | Consulting Manager | Finance Transformation | Driving Spending Efficiency
detailed_profile.about: I am a results-driven consulting manager with over 10 years of experience across the Middle East, combining deep expertise in finance transformation, performance improvement, and operational excellence. At PwC, I specialize in advising public and semi-governmental entities, particularly in Saudi Arabia; on driving spending efficiency, optimizing financial processes, and implementing strategic operating models. I bring a unique blend of audit discipline and advisory insight to each engagement, enabling practical, data-backed solutions. I have led high-impact projects covering budgeting and planning, cost-saving initiatives, AR optimization, and reporting frameworks that directly supported executive decision-making. Known for my hands-on leadership style, I foster strong relationships with clients and teams, consistently delivering measurable outcomes in complex environments.

projects.title: Core Lending Platform
projects.description: Strategised and planned the roadmap for the new core lending platform for Pintek based on the customers requirements and past feedbacks from the support teams. Prioritised roadmaps. Identified individual modules for customer journey and back office. Worked on defining the specifications for each of these modules. Developed specification documents in to Product Requirement Documents and wireframes (using Whimsical). Worked with UI / UX team to deliver high fidelity designs on Figma and performed a user experience testing before development process.Worked with technology team for delivery of the product. Marketing team to define the GTM.Helped support teams to understand the technical & financial modules of the product and established a feedback loop for continuous improvements.

projects.title: Wealth Management System
projects.description: Background : Developed this project for a wealth management subsidiary of a bank in Indonesia. Following were the requirements :1. Design and develop the whole Role Management and User management system for the wealth subsidiary which will be connected with the Human Resource Management system of the bank.2. Design and develop a Relationship manager based Mutual Fund Transactional platform for the banking customers which will be connected with the Core Banking systems for the payment purposes and the registry system (S-Invest) for the unit registry.3. Design and develop the marketing modules including the Campaign management, member get member/ referral modules and criteria based RM Commission dashboard.My Role :1. Business Analysis of the requirement from the client and documenting it. Created a Functional Requirement Document of 250 Pages which included flowcharts and user diagrams made in VISIO and LucidChart2. Analysing the mutual fund industry in Indonesia and the complete cycle of mutual fund buying. This was required to connect the systems to S-Invest systems.3. Complete data analysis of the information flowing from Core Banking systems to this system, checking API data points and making sure that the systems are ready before the SIT Process.4. Understanding the requirements from Regulatory (OJK) point of view to make sure that the client get the license when presenting the system to the regulator.5. Project Management : Managing a team of Developers and communicating them the financial requirements in technical terms. Managing their daily tasks on JIRA. Following the scrum methodology.

projects.title: Robo Intelligent Investment Platform
projects.description: Being an Investor, may it be the beginning or advanced stage, it is always a question on what exactly should I invest in to? Will my investments give me returns as per my requirements and needs? Do my investments suits my risk Appetite? To solve all these issues, there are advisors in the big investment firms who basically follow a pre-determined script to analyse your risk and return appetite and then provide you a suitable portfolio. But then these advisory benefits are only available to the HNIs and the institutional businesses. But the advisory business is following a set of rules and protocols and we knew that these can be digitised. With Robo Intelligent platform, we included all these set of rules and protocols in to the system and facilitated the low income group to invest with a Robo based advisor which can assess the multiple parameters and provide a tailor made investment strategies.My Role :1. Business Analysis of the Market used to develop the whole model portfolio strategy based on Modern Portfolio Theory.2. Presentation of this platform to the Regulator for licensing purpose.3. Product Lifecycle development based on the latest trends.4. Project Management : Managing a team of Developers and communicating them the financial requirements in technical terms. Managing their daily tasks on JIRA. Following the scrum methodology.

publications.title: MISSUS experiment onboard BEXUS 15: an innovative integrated sensors suite for meteorological measurements in low pressure environments and for attitude reconstruction
publications.subtitle: 21st ESA Symposium on European Rocket & Balloon Programmes and Related Research, Thun, CH, 9-13 June 2013
publications.description: ABSTRACTThis paper describes the MISSUS experiment (Meteorological Integrated Sensor SUite for Stratospheric Analysis), developed at CISAS (Center for Studies and Activities for Space “G.Colombo”) with the aim to characterise the most significant environmental paraeters of thin atmospheres nd fully reconstruct attitude and trajectory. MISSUS flew onboard the BEXUS15 ESA/SSC/DLR stratospheric balloon in September 2012 and it has been designed to collect meteorological and attitude data and validate the atmospheric models during the ascent, cruise and descent phases. The flight provided an unique opportunity for testing the onboard innovative instrumentation, which has been designed basing on CISAS previous know-how on balloon flights and space missions. In particular, MISSUS temperature sensor is the prototype of the MarsTem, the instrument which will be part of the DREAMS suite (Dust characterization, Risk assessment, and Environment Analyser on the Martian Surface) onboard ESA Mission Exomars 2016. The design and the results are presented.

projects.title: Zefiro
projects.description: The project consists in the development of the preliminary design for the innovative tandem seat ultralight motorglider "Zefiro".It was part of the exam of the university course "Aircraft Design" and lead the team to the win of the "VITAL 2014 scholarship".

projects.title: MISSUS
projects.description: MISSUS is conceived as an innovative integrated multi-sensor scientific package dedicated to the characterization of the most significant environmental parameters of thin atmospheres (such as temperature, pressure, wind velocity, humidity) and to attitude and trajectory reconstruction. The goal was to collect meteorological and attitude data and validate the atmospheric models during the ascent, cruise and descent phases, based on a synergic approach in the data analysis (data fusion).The instruments suite has been developed at CISAS, University of Padova (Italy) and flew on board the BEXUS15 ESA/SSC/DLR balloon in October 2012.

- Facilitate the communication flow between corporate and local areas.

- Continuous improvement process owner.
